solution_line_template: The first movie was {minutes_per_hour} + {first_movie_extra_minutes} = <<{minutes_per_hour}+{first_movie_extra_minutes}={first_movie_total_minutes}>>{first_movie_total_minutes} minutes long since an hour has {minutes_per_hour} minutes.

The second movie was {first_movie_total_minutes} + {second_movie_extra_minutes} = <<{first_movie_total_minutes}+{second_movie_extra_minutes}={second_movie_total_minutes}>>{second_movie_total_minutes} minutes long.

It took them a total of {first_movie_total_minutes} + {second_movie_total_minutes} = <<{first_movie_total_minutes}+{second_movie_total_minutes}={total_movie_watching_minutes}>>{total_movie_watching_minutes} minutes to watch the two movies.
It took them {popcorn_making_minutes} x {fries_multiplier} = <<{popcorn_making_minutes}*{fries_multiplier}={fries_cooking_minutes}>>{fries_cooking_minutes} minutes to cook the fries.
Thus, it took them a total of {popcorn_making_minutes} + {fries_cooking_minutes} = <<{popcorn_making_minutes}+{fries_cooking_minutes}={total_cooking_minutes}>>{total_cooking_minutes} minutes to cook.

So, they spent {total_movie_watching_minutes} + {total_cooking_minutes} = <<{total_movie_watching_minutes}+{total_cooking_minutes}={total_time_in_minutes}>>{total_time_in_minutes} minutes watching the movies and cooking.
In hours, this is equal to {total_time_in_minutes}/{minutes_per_hour} = <<{total_time_in_minutes}/{minutes_per_hour}={total_time_in_hours}>>{total_time_in_hours} hours.
